fields.description:
Select a Windows IS or any EBS backed instance, use it to create an image. 

Questions: 
* what state can the instance be in to do this? Running (IS and EBS) and Stopped (EBS).
* what kinds of guardrails can we put into place? Client-side validation 
* what are the externally visible parameters? Name, description, sharing (make public, keep private for now), tags, BDM (for EBS only, do we need this first-out?)
 
Not exposed externally:
* Bucket policy will be generated (hard-coded?) by console that is transparent to users
* Keys can be extracted by console for the API calls

User-facing:
* The noReboot option will default to false.
* Can client-side validate format of image name, bucket name, bucket prefix
* Can pre-fill suggestion for bucket name and prefix
* Need a confirmation dialog for this action, to let people know what will happen and be sure they are ready for it
* Bundle is Windows only for AWS.   For Eucalyptus it is Windows and Linux
* Cancel is only available for IS, not for EBS

Needs investigation:
* When bundling, the console will wait for a status of Complete on the task and then console will request register with no manual intervention required on the part of the user. If something in the browser goes belly-up when we are in an intermediate state between bundle and register, console needs to store that state somehow and automatically re-request register when the console comes back up. We will most likely do this with a tag on the bucket (or objects in the bucket). we could have a bucket reserved for console use (need to still account for the case where the user specifies a specific bucket), with a console-specific tag namespace. This tag would not be exposed to end users, but would be used by the console to indicate bundle tasks that have been registered vs those that have not.

Will not implement:
* Eucalyptus can bundle an EBS instance into an instance-store image.  Se will not include this in the console options, it's an uncommon and undocumented procedure

Needs documentation:
* [~tvo] to stub this

https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Create+image
https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Manage+Images+Landing

fields.summary: SPIKE: Investigate if tag-based approach is adequate for recovery from intermediate bundling state

comments.body: We need to figure out a way to support this, transparency to the user was the whole point of this design.
thanks, Kamal. I'll get going on this tomorrow assuming you might get more done the rest of today. I don't want to step on your toes.

on the "create bucket for me" option, according to the API docs, this is un-necessary [~jloza]
"The bucket in which to store the AMI. You can specify a bucket that you already own or a new bucket that Amazon EC2 creates on your behalf. If you specify a bucket that belongs to someone else, Amazon EC2 returns an error."
[~dkavanagh]: I think it is necessary, but it needs a text entry field added to specify the bucket name? You have to specify a bucket, either existing or new.
Right, we do need bucket name, but creation is handled automatically.
[~dkavanagh] do we also need the prefix in that case or just the name?

Per http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-BundleInstance.html
Bucket and prefix are required. I think the bundling CLI tools normally use "image" as the prefix unless one is specified. Perhaps a default prefix is also OK for us?
[~dkavanagh] moving discussion to wireframe comments, makes more sense to have it there since wireframes live longer than Jira tickets.

more from arch meeting... for metadata stored in S3, version it (to match current software version). If a version not matching current version is found, ignore and delete it. We won't support bundle operations spanning upgrades.

TODO list:
- ensure images "in progress" don't show up in wizard image panels (but still perform the register if a completed bundle task is found, and make that image available to the user) DONE
- disable menu actions for images that you can't do when the image isn't available (i.e. almost all of them!) DONE
- don't allow 2nd bundle operation for instance that already has a bundle operation in progress (use popup, don't disable menu) (implemented but not appearing.. save for later)
- for IS images in progress, prefix instance ID with 'p' to come up with temporary ID to use in image detail page. When task completes and image is registered, ensure page refreshes with correct ID DONE
- convert landing page item fetch to POST as well as image detail page status fetch DONE
- pass tags in metadata, use them on registered image DONE
- pass bdm in metadata, use it when registering image DONE
The bulk of the work is done. I'd like to get this mass of changes reviewed/merged sooner than later and follow up with smaller code changes later.

Hey [~dkavanagh], I reassigned this to me, since we talked in our team meeting last week about UX review before code review...we can make sure the UX is all GTG and then I'll pass it to [~kgill].

Thanks for the awesome work! I'll try and get this reviewed ASAP.
This not working prevents us from fully testing the UX of progress reporting.

Awesome job so far, [~dkavanagh], I know this was tricky and tons of work.

Initial UX review comments:

Create image dialog: 
* Machine section missing title (done)
* Storage section not indented properly (see how it doesn't left-align with the other sections?) (done)
* storage section needs more space between labels and text fields (done)
* all text fields on the dialog should be left aligned (see wireframe, they all line up, even across sections) (done)
* storage section bubble help icon should be between label and text field, not after text field (done)
* required fields label should be at bottom right (done)
* please hide advanced accordion (not just its content) if IS instance is selected. (done)
* Create Image button should be disabled until all required fields have data (done)
* warning dialog title does not have correct class applied for proper styling, and warning dialog title should not have a colon (I had the colon in the wireframe, that's my fault, I updated the wireframe). Second paragraph of warning dialog is missing the colon at the end (that one should be there)
* no reboot checkbox is indented too far (done)
* no reboot bubble help first sentence images is plural, should be singular (done)
* BDM table: size column is way too wide, should use that width to keep delete on terminate header from wrapping instead. Everything should be centered (headers and data in rows) (done)
* BDM add device labels should be left aligned on top of associated fields and should not have colons (done)
* BDM add device button should be disabled until all required fields have data (done)
* BDM widget is missing the "Add device:" and then "Add another device" thing that for example the tags and rules and users editors have, can you add that for consistency please? (done)
* Name field did not flag a validation error when I used a name with spaces. Only got error from the CLC after submitting. Please note validation error message should indicate "cannot contain spaces" as well as valid characters (done)

Question for you: Should I be reviewing the image landing and detail pages with this ticket? I didn't, but I can if you implemented that (minus the progress of course) as part of this story, just let me know. Thanks! Fantastic job overall! (yes, these were implemented)
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/870

Awesome job, D!

One small thing, you missed this one:

warning dialog title does not have correct class applied for proper styling, and warning dialog title should not have a colon (I had the colon in the wireframe, that's my fault, I updated the wireframe). Second paragraph of warning dialog is missing the colon at the end (that one should be there)
pushed that fix. tag, you're it!
Hi [~dkavanagh], I can't log in on this branch, I think maybe it needs develop pulled in to get the cache stuff?

UX review passed, ready for code review. 

Please note, steps still missing on warning dialog, those will be added under a separate user story since we are waiting on the info from [~dmitrii] and this is otherwise good to go. That way we can get this into QA. Thanks!
Pull request 870 merged

This will require more work when the blocking tasks are completed. We will need to:
 - Stop generating new access/secret for bundling (DONE)
 - Generate a new STS token (using GetAccessToken) using the user's password which we will now require for bundling (DONE)
 - new creds will have a 24 hour expiry (vs the current defaults) (DONE)
 - Sign upload policy using new STS creds, then discard the creds. (DONE)
[~dkavanagh]: I see a new pull request for this ticket at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/984 .  Is that ready for review?
I've been hoping to get a system to test the changes on, but QA's been fighting me at each turn. I'm trying to fire up a new system now. Feel free to review, but there could be code changes still.
[~dkavanagh]: I've merged PR 984, so feel free to push this one to QA if no additional work is required here.
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1008
Testing this requires latest #testing on the back end and the latest euca2ools on the NCs
Punting back to [~dkavanagh] to fix an i8n issue in latest pull request.

fixed i18n issue;
Tested issue with instance being terminated/removed. When visiting the image page for the temporary image (with the pi- designation), a 404 is now produced. I think this is reasonable since they are now looking for something that no longer exists. If the instance was terminated during bundling, bundling will fail and showing them the image landing page isn't necessarily helpful either.
Pull request 1008 merged
